Immersive Conversion

Immersive Conversion is a mod which aims to overhaul and expand the stock ISRU system to enrich the experience of heavily modded KSP. It doesn't do much on its own, but with the help of @JadeOfMaar's Rational Resources, it provides semi-realistic resource acquisition and conversion chains, as well as other patches for compatibility and consistency, to connect many popular mods into one cohesive web. The ultimate goal is something similar to the resource chains you'll find in MKS, but slightly less complex and more modular rather than centralised and all-encompassing. Building self-sustaining colonies that launch their own rockets shouldn't be easy.

The core of the mod consists of modifications and minimal additions to stock parts, forming the foundational ISRU system using the Community Resource Pack and Rational Resources, which is also patched onto parts from other mods. On top of this, there will be a few optional extensions which mostly consist of patches to extend functionality for mods like USI Life Support and Extraplanetary Launchpads to other mods, including new resource chains and potentially some new parts too. Target mods include but are not limited to:

  • Near Future Technologies
  • Far Future Technologies
  • Stockalike Station Parts Redux
  • Planetside Exploration Technologies
  • HabTech2
  • Kerbal Planetary Base Systems
  • Stockalike Mining Extension
  • Keridian Dynamics

Feel free to suggest additions to this list. It would also be very sensible to use Space Dust alongside Immersive Conversion.

 

Here's an overview of the core design, representing what I've implemented so far. After a bit of polishing, I'll release something for people to play around with and get a feel for the balance.

Drill-O-Matics

Drill-O-Matics come in three varieties which each acquire a different category of resource: basic minerals [yellow], ices [blue] and metals [red].

  • Basic mineral drills are the stock drills, allowing you to mine Ore, as well as Hydrates and Silicates.
  • Ice-specialised drills can directly mine Water, LqdCO2, LqdAmmonia, and perhaps others in future.
  • Metal-specialised drills can directly mine Spodumene, MetallicOre, Uraninite and ExoticMinerals, and perhaps others in future.

Convert-O-Trons

Convert-O-Trons no longer use Ore, rather they are used to produce propellant by real chemical processes. You'll have to acquire the various input resources from ice mining, sifting atmospheres and exospheres, or as by-products of other production chains.

  • Electrolysis: Water → LqdHydrogen + Oxidizer
  • Sabatier process: LqdCO2 + LqdHydrogen → LqdMethane + Water
  • Haber process: LqdNitrogen + LqdHydrogen → LqdAmmonia
  • Hydrocarbon synthesis: Organics → LiquidFuel or LiquidMethane

Smelt-O-Trons

Smelt-O-Trons are metal-smelting analogues of the Convert-O-Trons which are currently represented by reskinned Convert-O-Trons and might get their own models eventually.

  • Can produce small amounts of metal products from generic Ore.
  • Converts particular ores with much higher yields, namely Spodumene into Lithium, MetallicOre into Metals, and ExoticMinerals into RefinedExotics.
  • Additionally allows the heating of Hydrates to release Water.

 

As for what all these resources are for, that depends on your choice of mods, but I can tell you I plan for the following in the optional extensions:

  • LqdAmmonia + Oxidiser → Fertilizer (representing ammonium nitrate)
  • Hydrates → Fertilizer (representing mineral fertilisers generally, but gypsum mostly)
  • Fertilizer + Mulch + Water → Supplies (plain old USI Life Support doesn't require Water, but it's one of the more easily obtained resources, so why not throw it in)
  • LqdMethane → Organics (a higher energy pyrolytic process, for when you need Organics but all you can manage is basic chemicals)
  • Mulch → Organics + Water (a slow source of Organics which may only be sustainable in large colonies)
  • Uraninite → EnrichedUranium (for centrifuges and such which currently use Ore)
  • Silicates → Ablator (replacing other Ablator recipes you might find)
  • Silicates → Silicon (for complicating the RocketParts chain)
  • Organics → Polymers (for complicating the RocketParts chain, possibly other uses)
  • Silicon + Polymers + RefinedExotics → SpecializedParts (for really complicating the RocketParts chain (making rockets in situ should be hard))
  • Metals + SpecializedParts → RocketParts (at last)

Also worth noting that RefinedExotics are very valuable, so production and return to Kerbin would be a feasible late-game cash cow in career mode if contracts aren't cutting it.

Woo! Nice to see that you're starting this. Seeing the part suites and chains in point form really helps to present a simplified view of all this.

I like the Smelt-O-Tron bit in particular. It's a very nice expansion to my concept for the RR Blacksmith furnace.
